Summary: GC 15/1. Thaw continues. Very isolated snow patches diminishing, mainly on N-E aspects above 900m. The Hazard is Low.
SnowDistribution: Diminishing snowpack, with only isolated patches remaining above 900 metres. Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells. Winds approx 10 - 20 mph.
Comment: Some isolated ice remains which will be prone to collapse. Thawing conditions continuing at least until the weekend.
WeatherInfluences: Mild conditions continue, remaining mainly dry with sunny periods. Strong South-Westerly winds, possibly very strong at higher elevations. The freezing level will remain well above the summits.
SnowStability: Any remaining isolated patches of snow will be soft and continue to thaw, potentially melting away.  Only snow patches in higher sheltered locations, mainly on North to East aspects above 900 metres will possibly remain. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It continued to be mild at all elevations overnight and through the day. Mainly dry and cloudy with occasional periods of drizzle or light rain, blown in on moderate to fresh West to North-Westerly winds.
ObservedSnowStability: With the thaw continuing, the already significantly depleted snow cover has further reduced to very isolated insignificant patches of soft wet snow. These patches are mainly on steeper North to East aspects above 900 metres and continue to diminish. Some thawing ice remains at higher elevations and is prone to collapse. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: TO for 15/01. Dry, FL remaining well above summits, very strong SW winds. Low hazard.
SnowDistribution: Wet diminishing snowpack.  Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells.  Winds 20-30 mph on the summits, progress difficult at times with stronger gusts.
Comment: Further snow loss will continue over the coming days due to warm temperatures, and strong South-Westerly winds.
WeatherInfluences: It is forecast to be dry throughout the period with the freezing level remaining well above summit levels. Winds will remain very strong to gale force South-Westerly over the tops.
SnowStability: The wet snowpack will remain stable, well bonded and continue to thaw. The largest remaining expanses are to be found mainly on East to Southerly aspects above 800 metres. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It was a dry cloudy day. Winds were very strong South-Westerly. The freezing level was well above the tops with 4 degrees celsius at summit levels.
ObservedSnowStability:
Snow loss continues. The remaining wet snowpack is stable and well bonded. Largest patches can be found on steep East to Southerly aspects above 800 metres.
The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: LO for 15/1/25. The patchy snowpack will continue to thaw and consolidate and stability will be good. Low avalanche hazard.
SnowDistribution: Wet, patchy snowpack. Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells. Winds 20 - 30 mph at summit level.
Comment: Falling ice and rock remain a hazard in the mild conditions.
WeatherInfluences: It will remain dry with strong South-South-Westerly winds. The freezing level will be above the summits.
SnowStability: The patchy snowpack will continue to thaw and consolidate and stability will be good. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It was a dry day with a fresh West-South-Westerly wind. The freezing level was above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snowpack is thawing and consolidating in all locations and stability is good. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: NC for 15.01.25 Stability will be good. Wet snow instabilities and glide avalanche risk mainly on S aspects above 1000m. Hazard Low.
SnowDistribution: Diminishing and wet snowpack. Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells. Winds 30-40 mph, progress difficult and tiring.
Comment: Continuing risk from ice and rock fall in the mild temperatures.
WeatherInfluences:
The freezing level will remain above the summits. It will be a dry day with a gale force South-Westerly airstream.  
Partly cloudy in the morning becoming sunny in the afternoon.
SnowStability: The thawing, patchy snowpack will continue to consolidate and stability will be generally good, however, wet snow instabilities and full depth avalanches are an increasing risk on very steep terrain above 1000 meters such as gully tops and steep rollovers.  Sun affected Southerly aspects will mostly be affected. Remaining cornices will be prone to collapse. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry day with the freezing level above the summits. Partly cloudy.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snowpack is thawing and consolidating in all locations and stability is generally good. Isolated wet snow instabilities are present, mainly above 1000 metres on steep North-West through South-East to South-West aspects. Remaining cornices are prone to collapse. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: CM for 15.1 Patchy snowpack will continue to thaw + consolidate on all aspects and at all levels. Stability generally good. Haz Low
SnowDistribution: Wet patchy snowpack. Cloudy on the Western tops; brighter in the East.  Winds 25-35 mph.
Comment: In these thaw conditions falling rocks and any remaining ice are an additional hazard.
WeatherInfluences: It will remain dry and mild, with the freezing level above the summits. Winds will be very strong mainly South-South-Westerly.
SnowStability: The patchy snowpack will continue to thaw and consolidate on all aspects and at all levels. Stability will generally be good. The possibility of minor full depth avalanches from ledges and shelves on crags of North-East through East to South aspects remains. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It was a dry, mild day with the freezing level above all summits. Winds were strong West-South-Westerly.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snowpack continues to thaw and consolidate on all aspects and at all levels. Stability is generally good. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: SC for 15.1: Thaw conditions. Greatest snow cover on E, SE, S, SW aspects above 900m. Patchy cover elsewhere. Avalanche Hazard Low.
SnowDistribution: Wet and diminishing snowpack. Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells. Winds 30-40 mph, progress difficult and tiring, blowing us over on occasions.
Comment: The thaw continues, with the freezing level around 3000 metres. Snow cover now patchy, soft and wet throughout. There remains a possible hazard of falling ice and rocks from steep ground.
WeatherInfluences: Freezing levels will remain above the highest summits throughout the forecast period. Winds will be very strong South-Westerlies and no precipitation is expected.
SnowStability: The thawing and patchy snowpack will continue to consolidate and remain stable and generally well bonded. The greatest snow accumulations will be found on East through South to South-West aspects above 900 metres. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry and bright day with very strong West-South-Westerly winds. The freezing level was above the highest summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The diminished snowpack is thawing and consolidating on all aspects and at all levels. The greatest snow coverage remains on East through South to South-West aspects above 900 metres. The avalanche hazard is Low.
